pageContext.claim: “We've created more than 400,000, that's soon going to be 600,000 manufacturing jobs.”
pageContext.analysis: U.S. manufacturing employment has been increasing at a steady rate since 2010. When Trump made this statement, the Bureau of Labor Statistics had said that 382,000 manufacturing jobs had been added since Trump took office, but two days later, in a report on the August job picture, the BLS revised the figure downward, to 348,000, indicating the president’s tariff war was taking a toll on manufacturing.
